attributes.action: Recognise Care Assistants as an actual career and better pay more than N.M.W.
attributes.background: Care Assistants should be recognised as an actual career path and should be paid better than the National Minimum Wage or 2016 renamed (National Living Wage) and be able to progress up the ladder with educational help available.
attributes.additional_details: People who go into the Vulnerable Adult Sector I.e. Care Assistants work 12 hour shifts sometimes do not even get time to have proper breaks because they are so busy get just the basic national minimum wage regardless of the new name and in some cases just don't even have the option to progress up the ladder this should be changed the minimum age should be changed to 21 to work as a Care Assistant and they should also feel valued Minimum Wage 12 Hour shifts does not make you feel valued.

attributes.action: Call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to engage with constituents
attributes.background: Every four years, EU citizens vote on democratic representatives in the European Parliament (MEPs). Very few people know who their MEP is. If the UK votes to stay in the European Union, the Government must call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to be more accessible and open to constituents.
attributes.additional_details: Various surveys showing how much people in the UK know about their MEP http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/may/10/voters-cant-name-their-mep http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/hands-up-if-you-know-who-your-mep-is-8679242.html

attributes.action: We want a referendum to be held on English membership of the United kingdom.
attributes.background: England would be stronger outside the United Kingdom for the simple reason that Scotland, Wales and Northern island  contribute far less to the Union than they take out. As a result of this England would be stronger outside the UK.

attributes.action: Restrict who can buy UK land and property to uk residents only
attributes.background: It is very concerning that persons who live in other countries and are not resident here are allowed to purchase housing stock, further pushing up prices for uk residents when there are limited resources.

attributes.action: Ban all Pornographic material
attributes.background: Pornography is a fake stimulus which is crippling the expectations and behaviour of more people, the young especially. This industry exploits men and women, into a world where all dignity is degraded and even "shows off" illegal activity such as rape for others to enjoy. This encourages abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Simply using safety filters is not enough. Many young children can easily by pass these filters, when Government and parents believe their children are safe.(http://www.expertreviews.co.uk/software/internet-security/1402585/how-your-kids-are-beating-your-parental-controls-and-is-there). 
One main argument for porn is that it helps couples. In more cases than not it DESTROYS relationships. (https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/tech-support/201407/what-porn-does-intimacy). So what is it for?

attributes.action: UK should double its Gold because other central banks are buying up all the gold
attributes.background: Gold is money and has been for thousands of years. The money we use today is the faith backed fiat system.People have started to loose faith in the dollar and all other fiat currencies like the Euro.The only way forward is a gold backed currency.
attributes.additional_details:
Interesting websites regarding gold as money

HTTPS://www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Http://kingworldnews.com
Http://www.dailyreckoning.co.uk

attributes.action: Drivers to take a refresher driving test when renewing their driving licence.
attributes.background: The standard of driving in the United Kingdom has deteriorated dramatically in recent years, and the problem is that once a driver has passed their test, they can drive on a UK licence until they reach 70 years of age. In order to reduce accidents, we need a new, more proactive approach.

attributes.action: Introduce topics about gender equality and racial equality to the curriculum.
attributes.background: School is supposed to provide people an education so that they be ready for the 'real world'. What is the point when people aren't educated on social justice matters? The lack of education on racial and gender issues leaves a lot of people growing up with narrow-minded and ignorant opinions.
attributes.additional_details: I know first hand that the majority of boys in school will continue to think it is acceptable to objectify and show little respect to girls. In addition, many of the students will think it is okay to make racist remarks because they don't know any better. There is a platform that reaches these students' minds and can influence their thinking. We need to make it so they won't leave school uneducated on basic respect and social issues.

attributes.action: Compulsory yearly test for secondary school teachers in their respective subject
attributes.background: Secondary school teachers that teach GCSE or A-Level classes should take the respective test in their subject every year and score very highly to ensure that the teaching standards are adequate throughout the nations' schools.
attributes.additional_details: If students are to perform well at school they should be taught by teachers that have throughout knowledge of the curriculum. It would also ensure equality as a student should not be at a disadvantage to their peers if they have a teacher who is not able to teach the curriculum to a satisfactory standard. Failure of the teacher to score highly on the tests they are teaching to should result in intervention and perhaps further training.

attributes.action: Scrap Air Passenger Duty (APD) on all UK flights
attributes.background:
Air Passenger Duty (APD) is the UK Government tax that is currently being charged on all passengers departing from a UK airport. Which since introduction in 1994, has risen by up to 539%.

Abolishing APD would see a significant increase in the UK’s GDP as well as the creation thousands of jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK ranks 137th out of 138 when it comes to air ticket taxes and charges - 2015 World Economic Forum’s Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report.

Only six EU countries levy a similar tax, but with substantially lower rates than those in the UK.

The high charges of APD are severely hindering economic growth in the UK's Transport and Leisure Industry. In order to boost economic growth and improve competitiveness in the market, I urge the UK government to scrap APD.

attributes.action: I would like to see the regulation of Management Agencies for new build flats
attributes.background: I pay a managing agent a large fee for my new build flat. The managing agent has destroyed our sinking fund and charged us an obscene amount for 'changing bulbs' - They have no one to answer to! Millions of homeowners have to succumb to these agencies who are ever increasing service charges.

attributes.action: Make the UK safer place from terrorism.
attributes.background: Allow non uniform police and HM Forces personnel aswell as ex services to be allowed to carry a short barrel weapon assuming they have passed all annual training directives (A.D.T).Terrorism is now becoming the number one subject in our daily lives,people are constantly under threat.
attributes.additional_details: An observation made this week by myself whilst walking through a main line London tube station showed our only defence in London "The Metropolitan Police" looking at the ground constantly whilst on patrol. Is London safe? Who knows when terrorism may occur the main question is are we ready to defend our selfs and others?

attributes.action: Scrap emission based VED on private vehicles as it takes no account of miles pa
attributes.background:
Emission based VED takes no account of mileage.
A high VED vehicle paying £505 pa may only do 3000 miles pa and another vehicle paying £120 pa 20,000 miles pa
Have a basic VED for all  private vehicles incl electric and the rest  funded by tax on fuel for a pro rata rate of road usage

attributes.action: Ban the use of opinion polls in the run up to elections and referenda.
attributes.background: Opinion polls have become tools for influencing people's voting decisions and should be completely banned.
attributes.additional_details: The 2015 General Election was badly affected by them and so will the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Stop the government from forcing mathematics on children until they are 18.
attributes.background: The government want children to study maths in schools until they are 18. At this age people are preparing to start careers and will know whether or not they need maths to start their career. At 16-18 the focus should be on supporting children's ambitions. People's choices are being taken away.

attributes.action: We believe the Government should increase fuel duty to protect PIP payments.
attributes.background:
In this year's Budget, the Chancellor made changes to PIP.
The role of Government is to protect the most vulnerable.
By cutting PIP payments, the Government is taking away a vital source of income to those who need it the most.
We believe fuel duty should be increased by 2p a litre to protect PIP

attributes.action: Reject proposals to increase Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: The Chancellor may use the budget to increase insurance premium tax (IPT) as he did last year. This may seem an obscure tax but it will heavily  impact those paying the highest premiums already - the young and those who live in high risk areas - often the people least able to afford any increase.
attributes.additional_details: In the last budget the Chancellor increased IPT from 6% to 9.5%. Rumours are taht he may increase it a further 3% which would put £37 on the average car insurance premium. It would also increase home, pet and medical insurance as well as car breakdown cover. It is a pernicious tax because, while it affects everyone, it disproportionately affects the young and those who live in high risk areas who are least likely to be able to afford it.

attributes.action: Stop Crossrail 2 from destroying Iconic buildings in Wimbledon town.
attributes.background: This will effect so many peoples lives during the construction phase over the next 8-10 years, as buildings, homes and companies are demolished leaving business owners scrambling for new jobs. Wimbledon would also be clogged up with traffic jams. This,ultimately will effect the future of Wimbledon.
attributes.additional_details:
At first I was excited about Crossrail 2, until the government revealed the building being demolished. 

The following are the names of companies/buildings that will be demolished:
Center Court
Waitrose

Everyday church

attributes.action: Put a limit on when HGV's and Tractors can access Main Roads and Motorways
attributes.background: During "rush hour" periods 0700-0900 and 1700-1900, HGV's and Tractors should not be allowed on Main Roads or Motorways due to the fact that they make every journey longer.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of collisions and spillages on roads especially Motorways involve a HGV during busy periods, This leads to severe delays and road closures impacting the remaining 99% of road travellers time at home. 
By limiting the times to which they can travel the rush hour periods should run more smoothly allowing traffic to flow with less accidents

attributes.action: Permanently move Parliament to a more UK population central location.
attributes.background: The seat of power in the UK has for too long resided in a place inaccessible to most of the country. This has resulted in generations of regional underinvestment and the revenue creation capacity of our country massively skewed to financial services in the City, Greater London and the South East
attributes.additional_details: With a new parliament location a more commutable distance, we can also do away with the cost of many second homes for MPs. The £40+Billion cost of HS2 can be reallocated to pay for a new Parliament building (The final cost of Holyrood was put at £414M) and the renewal of the rail infrastructure to support it. After hundreds of years of revenue flowing from the rest of the UK to the South East, it’s about time it started seeding sustainable growth elsewhere.

attributes.action: MAKE THE SPOUSAL VISA REQUIREMENTS ACHIEVABLE! STOP MAKING PEOPLES LIVES SO HARD
attributes.background: It Is Far Too Hard For People To Earn £18'600 Per Annum! Let Alone Have Savings Of £62'000! It Is Pathetic!!
attributes.additional_details: I Have Friends And Family Struggling Because Of This And It Is Just Not Right!!!

attributes.action: NHS pensions for ALL Dental Care Professionals who work in NHS Dental Practices.
attributes.background: Dental Care Professionals working in General Dental Practices with an NHS contract, providing NHS care are not entitled to an NHS pension and the full benefits of providing NHS care to patients. Working under or alongside NHS Dental practice owners or associate dentists who are entitled to this.
attributes.additional_details: All members of the Dental Team whether that be a Dental Nurse working along side an NHS dentist, Dental Therapists and Hygienists who work under a Dentist or associates prescription, or the Practice Managers and reception/admin staff ALL contribute to an NHS contract and the NHS care provided to patients.

attributes.action: Give English voters a say in the event of a 2nd Scottish Independence referendum
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon is calling for a new Referendum on Scottish Independence. In the event such a referendum is granted, we demand that a vote is given to all English voters to give us a choice on whether or not we want to keep Scotland, and move our military contracts South of the Border to England!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/nicola-sturgeon-launches-second-scottish-independence-referendum-drive-after-brexit-vote/ar-AAioSmM?li=BBoPWjQ

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Keep the production, sale and use of cannabis illegal.
attributes.background: Cannabis is a harmful drug. It's not a recreational substance that should be classed as "legal" as doing this will only make it more accessible to vulnerable young people and consequently cause more damage to our society.

attributes.action: Change the location of the layby on the A38 southbound near Ripley
attributes.background: As there have been a couple of accidents here and recently the loss of a motorcyclist vs a HGV earlier this week. The layby is so close to the sliproad that people mistake it for one. Which needs to be changed before this happens again. The last one was a fatality. Let's leave it at that!

attributes.action: Educate society about Epilepsy and eradicate the stigma surrounding it
attributes.background: More than 500,000 people in the UK have epilepsy, which is a condition that affects the brain and causes repetitive seizures. There is a stigma around epilepsy that needs to be addressed, starting with the lack of knowledge the public have about what to do when someone has a seizure.
attributes.additional_details: Educating children from a young age in a First Aid class would severely decrease the stigma around epilepsy and therefore allow those with epilepsy to feel more accepted in the community. By placing a programme of First Aid in primary and secondary schools where children learn about what to do when witnessing a seizure- not touching the person or placing anything in their mouths etc- would make epilepsy a much less lonely and frightening condition.

attributes.action: Discuss the need for a national register for non-participatory fathers.
attributes.background: I feel this register is much needed and highly overdue. Fathers who have children and then, (when it doesn't work with their co-creators) decide to penalise their own children by not regularly visiting, contributing or communicating. This Leaves the mother to counsell their young 'damaged' kids..
attributes.additional_details: I posted an enquiry if a register like this existed, and found one did but only for Domestic Violence (Clare's Law). However, this doesn't help those mothers (generally) who deal with their co-creators choice to not participate. A register is needed because it's a highly common issue, often seeing the same (mostly) men 're-offend' and go on to ruin even more young minds of growing children. This perpetual cycle often repeated could easily be stopped with a register. Divorce is common, so is this

attributes.action: To support a longer cease-fire in Syria to allow for food and medical aid
attributes.background: After the recent effects of the bombing in Aleppo, Syria, I would like to propose that we support a longer cease-fire to allow for key medical supplies to reach those who have been effected by War.
attributes.additional_details: In previous months the cease-fire has been only 48 hours, however this is too short a period of time for supplies to get to those who need it and to recover from the effects of injury, loss of home and even separation from loved ones.

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: Strengthen Laws against Negligent Private Surgeons & Healthcare Providers
attributes.background:
Private healthcare patients are commonly led to believe that the care they are paying for will meet the highest standards. 
In cases where patients receive wrongful or negligent treatment  private healthcare patients have less access to adequate redress and compensation than NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
At present legislation is so insufficient that one private healthcare company actually stated in a legal defence document that they were ‘under no obligation to provide competent surgeons to perform surgery at the hospital’ and had ‘no duty to protect patients from harm, and risk of injury’.

We ask Secretary of State for Health, Jeremy Hunt  to close the legal loophole which allows for private healthcare patients to be left without protection or redress when things go wrong.

attributes.action: I want a ban on Guns Knives Machetes Swords and other dangerous items.
attributes.background: Guns Knives Machetes Swords are sold openly at Car Boots Sales. We are in a climate where an attack on civilians could happen at any time and in any area. Legislation should be put in place to prevent this practice from continuing.

attributes.action: Require all planes to have a central locking system on their overhead lockers.
attributes.background: Following the incidents in Dubai  and Las Vegas it is clear that passengers cannot be trusted to act responsible during an emergency event on an aeroplane. To mitigate this and protect other passengers overhead lockers should be centrally locked by the pilot during take off and landing.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36985862

attributes.action: Make gift vouchers fair and stop companies keeping your money after expiry.
attributes.background: From refusal to issue change or a credit note when only part of a voucher is used to simply keeping your money if the voucher expires, these practices are unfair and should be stopped. I call for legislation to control the sale and terms of gift vouchers so that money is never allowed to disappear.
attributes.additional_details:
While class action lawsuits have been setting precedence in the US, the UK is still behind. 

A survey in September 2010 by Groupola.com suggested that Britons are have nearly £580m of unused gift vouchers. Many of these won't be honored by issuers.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2006/apr/29/consumernews.moneysupplement

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/chill-factore-gift-vouchers-trafford-8532757

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2011/jan/30/are-gift-card-waste-money

attributes.action: Criminalise deliberately or negligently misinforming a planning panel/committee.
attributes.background: It seems wrong to me that such an activity is not already criminal.
attributes.additional_details:
I asked a planning panel committee manager: 

'Am I right in thinking that anyone who intentionally or recklessly misinforms the panel is subject to criminal proceedings?'

and received the reply:
'No, if such a thing was to occur it would not amount to a criminal offence.'

This does not seem right to me.

attributes.action: Compel households to display a sign warning that there is a dog on the premises
attributes.background: Many people may call on a household on a daily basis for legitimate reasons and dog attacks are a significant hazard.  While the number of attacks has fallen after the change in legislation and greater understanding through dog awareness campaigns, it still remains unacceptably high.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, 2660 postmen/women were attacked by dogs in the last year some leading to a permanent disabling injury. As a postwoman myself I have had a dog bite, which fortunately wasn't serious, but have seen many colleagues that were not so lucky.

A simple sign at the entrance to a property and by the letterbox could help significantly. By making anyone calling at a house aware of the presence of a dog, they can take precautions to ensure their own safety and that of the dog living too.

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Limit the cost of mandatory insurance policies, i.e. motor insurance.
attributes.background: It is immoral to charge people inflated premiums when it is the law to ensure you have the insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies use statistics to seperate and ultimately increase charges applied to different parts of the population. More specifically it should be illegal to increase the motor insurance of someone for having an accident which wasn't their fault. If your no claims bonus had increased your premium must drop.

attributes.action: Legislate to give MPs the sole right to elect party leaders
attributes.background: Current Conservative and Labour Party rules leave the final choice of party leaders exclusively in the hands of party members. This is neither fair nor democratic. Party members do not represent the full spectrum of the electorate supporting their party at the polls, unlike elected MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
This risks the selection of leaders at the polar ends of their respective parties because party members do not represent the middle ground occupied by most voters. The recent leadership tribulations of both main parties illustrate this only too well. 
Legislation should be introduced in support of representational democracy to make it compulsory for all parties with more than 49 sitting MPs to give their MPs the sole responsibility for electing their leader

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.

attributes.action: Stop NHS healthcare surcharge as part of Non-EU immigration application.
attributes.background: Non-EEA nationals applying for UK visa applications are required to pay significant additional costs in relation to their applications. This is due to the introduction of a health surcharge to cover the costs of the migrant’s use of the NHS while in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-EEA nationals applying for UK visa applications are required to pay significant additional costs in relation to their applications. This is due to the introduction of a health surcharge to cover the costs of the migrant’s use of the NHS while in the United Kingdom.
The amount of the surcharge is as follows:
£200 per year for all migrants except:
Tier 4 students who will pay £150 per year

attributes.action: Make the smoking of tobacco in a household with children under 18 an offense.
attributes.background: In England there is already a ban on smoking in a car with children under 18, however smoke can linger within rooms of a home for long periods of time, this and smoke residue that falls on food and surfaces can put children the most at risk of health problems as their lungs are not fully developed.
attributes.additional_details:
"It’s estimated that, every year, second-hand smoke kills over 12,000 people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and the lung disease Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)."
- Cancer Research UK

http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking#qUzJibFS5IwmCGXk.99

attributes.action: Make it a regulation that support staff have a decent bed when on sleep ins
attributes.background:
I have worked in the care sector for years now and have a spinal disc hernia and arthritis in my back.
This I'm sure is caused by unsuitable cheap beds that support staff sleep on several times a week, care staff are known to have back problems in later life cheap beds are a huge contribution.

attributes.action: Stop the minting of Copper Coins
attributes.background: There is very little that can be purchsed for 1p or 2p now, so it is pointless having these coins. It is also a waste of money minting them. If the lowest denomination of coin minted was 5p then everything could be priced at £x.95 instead of £x.99
attributes.additional_details:
New Zealand's smallest coin is the 10c which is approximately equivalent to 5p (GBP)
Australia has scrapped its 1c & 2c and its 5c coin is approximately equivalent to 3p (GBP)
In the USA it has long been known that minting the 1c coin actually costs more than 1c per coin.
Many people in the UK often throw away 1p & 2p coins as they are practically worthless.

attributes.action: New floating national bank holiday in summer linked to hottest, sunniest day
attributes.background: There exists a need for a new national bank holiday between May and August. We propose new no fixed date, merely a floating day linked to the hottest / sunniest day of the year. That way everyone could have today off in the sunshine! This serves as a positive moral boost over unguaranteed weekends
attributes.additional_details: There are precedents of floating days such as Royal events or public mourning. This should be seen as an equal floating day but with a much more positive morale boost for the nation.

attributes.action: If the average temperature of the UK reaches 30ºC, a bank holiday is  declared.
attributes.background: This year it has taken until the 19th July for summer to arrive and for the temperature to surpass 30ºC, the hard working British people deserve better than having to commute and work on such a nice day. We have some of the greatest parks in the world we should use them more.
attributes.additional_details: We already have the least amount of bank holidays in the UK compared to the rest of Europe. (Germany has 13). It is a good excuse for society to come together and enjoy what seems to be last unifying British activity of frolicking in the sun.

attributes.action: Use Dog DNA to solve dog pooh problems
attributes.background: Dogs create around 1000 tons of pooh per day in the UK. Current initiatives are not effective in forcing owners to pick up their dogs pooh. As dogs now have to be microchipped, I propose that their DNA is included in the information on the microchip. This in turn can be used to trace the owners.
